comments.commentBody:
Arlene, So your AHA moment, now that you look back on it, all took place in HEINZ sight?
Actually, that's an excellent way in which to Ketchup!

WHH
Yes. NYT Sunday, AJ Santora back when. I think Will Weng was the editor at the time. Among the theme answers, (76)TROMBONES crossing PHILADELPHIA(76)RS.
Oh, no I actually remember that ....

It was the Heinz clue that was my AHA! moment. 57 VARIEITES. Of course.

Wasn't there a particularly wicked Sunday puzzle a number of years ago that also incorporated the clue numbers into the answers -- not in exactly the same way, but similar?

The people most hurt have been federal employees. Their wages have been frozen for years. That's a tax increase for them. Republicans are destroying the middleclass as well as america as we know it. I just traveled America by car the rt66 and 40 caalifornia to new england and back . All I saw were very poor people. It seems the only wealth is on the east and west coast. Our country has been hurt by endless wars and corporate giveways rightwing religious fanitics dominated the airwaves of my radio telling me obama is the antichrist and the world depends on defeating this basically good man. Abraham Lincoln was so hated by so many. Can theses hatemongers stop already?

Don't worry, they are not. Pictures of the day are just a series of snap shots trying to represent some  goings of the planet on a particular day without any particular intent. And, I'm pretty sure that people who visit this page are very well aware of the subtleties of the world situation.
Bush's operation was called "Wide Receiver". It evolved into Fast and Furious.

What would Mukasey have to say about whether Holder and other DOJ officials knew about the missing weapons and covered it up?

Also, your whole second point borders on science fiction. Issa is trying to see who knew what, and when. If it shows badly on Holder and Obama (as there is a high chance that it will) then that is the price of transparent government.

Ifyou had an assignment in college and the professor asked you to write a 10 page paper and you turned in three paragraphs, would you use that defense and say that it was better than nothing?

Memo to Winning Progressive:  Always love reading your thoughtful comments.  Somebody should be investigating the GOP (Greed Over the People) and Issa how he has used his position in Congress to make a fortune for himself.  It is laughable that the Congressional Republicans (elected on the jobs promise) are stooping so low in this matter!

As Charles Pierce at The Politics Blog on the Esquire website says, Congressman Issa's effort to turn "Fast & Furious" into an attack on AG Eric Holder should be referred to as "Fast & Spurious" because it is ridiculous.

First, the highly problematic Fast & Furious program was started by the DOJ under President W. Bush in 2006, and was ended by Holder and is being investigated by the DOJ's Inspector General. Yet, while Issa incessantly tries to conjure up a scandal against Holder, he refuses to even call the AG under Bush, Michael Mukasey, who started the program.

Second, Issa's witch hunt is being motivated by his belief in a conspiracy theory - namely, that Holder purportedly decided to continue the Fast & Furious program started by the Bush DOJ in order to create a crisis that would enable the Obama Administration to infringe on Second Amendment rights. The conspiracy theory is laughable on its face, especially given that Obama, unfortunately, has done virtually nothing to promote sensible gun safety legislation.

Third, Holder has already produced more than 7,000 pages of documents. The documents that DOJ is refusing to turn over relate to ongoing criminal investigations and, therefore, are not subject to Congressional subpoenas.

This isn't a "pointless partisan fight." It is another ridiculous partisan witch hunt by a GOP that has gone off the rails.

http://www.winningprogressive.org

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Winning-Progressive/195682780442236

The founder of the largest mercenary service, Blackwater, was a long term friend of the Bush family named Prince. Yes, Mr Prince did contribute humongously to the W Bush funds. And yes, the (criminal) war in Iraq was prolonged by up to ten additional years.

The prison guards association was the largest contributor to the anti-marijuana forces in the recent election in California (which contained a proposition that would have legalized the weed). Their apparent motto was, we don't care who we lock up as long as we get paid more.

Don't get me started on the two-thirds of medical practice which is either useless or actually harmful. Good public medicine (like other countries have) reduces these numbers a lot. (I have been active in medical research for 20 years.)

For more insights, go to YouTube and try Bill Benton Commentary.

(I was disappointed not to hear about Romney's dog, and therefore am not discussing the ultra-low taxes paid by the ultra-rich today.)
I forgot to add, it will work just like trickle down economics. Except once again only a few will profit
the retired people are the ones that need less, less, less, my friend.

During the Eisenhower administration the 1% paid an over 90% marginal tax rate.  Now they pay what, around 35%?  This is where the problem lies.  What good is being rich if  the infrastructure is falling apart and the poor are ready to revolt?
you are right.  and the Fed has hurt any lending to small business by paying interest on excess reserves.  see my comment below,

"We probably should have let everything collapse, "

Don't worry, the Republicans are still working towards that.

Politicians can do nothing. They're powerless. They have to set their positions in stone before they ever even take office. And when they are in office their loyalty is to the wealthy and the controllers of our financial system.

If the public at large doesn't begin to seriously question things and become genuinely concerned for each other, then it is likely that only WWIII will provide the needed incentive to change. And maybe then enough of us will be dead to allow the few wise ones who remain to start over the right way.

We have staked our ability to live as Human beings on a system of exchange that demands abject poverty as an essential condition of its function. In order for a few to prosper, many must be driven into poverty/suffering. This is a zero sum game. We all know this. And yet we all accept it. I really hope we wise up. http://www.perceivingreality.com

Peace to you and yours.

I work as a CPA. I cant tell you lower rates wont do a thing. I think they should raise rates .25 or .50.. why? Because it would shake the speculators out of the energy and food markets and result in more stimulus from lower prices. Any liquidity they are trying to pump in is getting gouged by higher prices. Plus as someone pointed out those with money are earning less. I am not sure what will fix this, but I can tell you that banks arent lending, small businesses have no access to financing or capital and I dont see anything moving. Everyone is working harder and harder for less while costs of things they must buy go up. The only people making money from lower long term rates are BANKS, who are playing casino games with the world economy. We probably should have let everything collapse, let prices implode then pumped money from the bottom. In trying to keep things floating we have created a Japan like scenario. The only thing average people with jobs can do is live as low as they can or below what they can afford and wait it out. Lower tax rates for the rich wont help (they havent and wont going forward due to outsourcing and hoarding of capital) and more Govt jobs programs wont help. We need a real lot of change, change that people are resistant to and thus I think it could get worse before it gets better because nothing will get better until it iis so bad the hard choices are made..
Print $267 billions more in six months to buy the long term bonds.  Only fed can do that!
Prescription for a Return to the Stone Age
end the fed and bring back the gold standard....

Actually during the Bernanke press conference, during which he often mentioned the need to find new echniques for getting our economy back in shape, a reporter from England asked if he new of the proposal to have the government support bank loans to citizens (e.g. for houses, cars) IF there was an agreement that the institution in question would lower their executives' salaries.   B said yes, he knew about this and that they were looking into it, that it was the sort of innovative policy he wanted to know more about.
Until we solve the housing crisis, our economy will remain in the dumps. When are we going to address this? It appears never. I cannot understand this.

Charles can you describe exactly the precipitating event and the subsequent sequence of disasters that would occur?   What is meant by 'any extended period of time'. Do we already have historical examples? More details are needed before we can accept your declaration.

On what do you base your belief? You are using politically charged words like "artificial" to evoke an emotional response. We have been "artificially" controlling a lot of things for a long time. Medicine artificially controls illness. Air conditioning artificially controls the temperature.  Sanitation artificially controls water bacteria.  Are those "artificial" controls bad too?

Artificial control of the Economy for any extended period of time, will ultimately cause the Economy to collapse, thus creating a major recession, with high interest rates, high inflation rates, worthless money, high job loss, and the probably of depression.

From a criminal perspective, this is over. Congress can't compel the US Attorney for the District to present the matter to a grand jury, and assuming this goes to the entire House, that same attorney will be ordered not to proceed (most probably by a deputy AG in order to keep Holder at arm's length from it.)

It's over with.
It is plain as day. I agree with the House panel and hope they move forward with charging AG Holder in contempt, which he most seemingly is.
This is timely! I was thinking how much I myself hold the current Congress in contempt.

So the GOP can spend valuable time digging up info on Mr. Holder. And yes, there should be some research into that operation. But how this trumps the economy and job creation is beyond me. It's just more political theater for those on the inside of the beltway....

This is what happens when politicians let politics get the best of their common sense. Obama and Holder are taking a hit for a program started under the Bush administration. A program that the Obama administration stopped. But rather than just tell the American people: we found this really stupid program in place, have ended it and will try to mitigate the negative impact - they decided to play politics and protect the Bush administration and their own butts. Well, now there is no protection and they're hanging out with no net. Yes, the GOP is simply getting their own back for Gonzales; but no one remembers Gonzales and no one cares that this is the Republicans doing to the Dems what was done to them. Just a stupid shame.
Yes it does.  They are holding our chief law enforcement officer accountable for crimes.

when have the republicans ever known anything? They keep doing the same thing, cutting taxes for the wealthy, and the economy keeps starving.

Where are the jobs that Issa is making by going after Holder? This is another example of the republicans sitting on their butts and blaming everybody else for the failures. Fast and Furious is a side-show that keeps the goons happy.
Holder is dirty and Obama's actions prove he is dirty too. If Holder were smart he would have resigned long ago to protect his boss. Instead, this fiasco will bring both of them down.

Ed, can you please list some examples of Obama's secretiveness and vindictiveness?  I here this kind of talk all the time from Ed's on the right, but they just say so, without offering any examples.  If Obama has been vindictive, there must be victims of his malice somewhere - where?  And why aren't they talking to the press about how President Vindictive has treated them.  Ed, you are living in a fantasy world about an Obama who simply does not exist.

This charade is pitiful. If this all the Republicans have to work with, it's going to be an ugly November for conservatives.

"It has since come to light that the bureau had used similar tactics three times in the Bush administration"
Since when does executive privilege only apply to direct communications with the president?  I hope you aren't actually practicing law, since your grasp appears a bit tenuous.
